docs.snippet: New York’s new, high-priced emergency dispatch system still has too many problems....
docs.abstract: Editorial warns that a consultant's report on New York City's new, high-priced emergency dispatch system raises worrisome questions about its effectiveness; urges Mayor Michael Bloomberg to look into the report's findings, and to implement its recommendations.
docs.lead_paragraph: New York’s new, high-priced emergency dispatch system still has too many problems.

docs.snippet: The Justice Department took an important stand when it declared that citizens have a right to videotape the actions of police officers in public places....
docs.abstract: Editorial applauds the Justice Department for affirming the right of citizens to videotape the actions of police officers in public places, and that seizure of such recordings violates constitutional rights; notes that the statement was made in a federal lawsuit brought against the Baltimore Police Department by Christopher Sharp, who recorded police arresting and beating a friend.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department took an important stand when it declared that citizens have a right to videotape the actions of police officers in public places.

headline.print_headline: Libyan’s Death Brings Up Debate Over His Release
headline.seo: Megrahi’s Death Revives Debate Over Trial and Release
headline.main: Libyan’s Death Brings Up Debate Over His Release

docs.snippet: Controversy arose again over who was ultimately responsible for the Lockerbie bombing and whether Abdel Basset Ali al-Megrahi was among them, or a scapegoat....
docs.abstract: Death of Abdel Basset Ali al-Megrahi of prostate cancer causes controversy to rise again over who was ultimately responsible for 1988 explosion that plunged Pan Am Flight 103 to the earth over Lockerbie, Scotland, and whether Megrahi, only man convicted in bombing, was among them, or simply a scapegoat; British Prime Min David Cameron says he is convinced that Megrahi is guilty and should never have been freed by the Scottish government in 2009 for compassionate reasons.

byline.contributor: Channing Joseph contributed reporting from New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: Controversy arose again over who was ultimately responsible for the Lockerbie bombing and whether Abdel Basset Ali al-Megrahi was among them, or a scapegoat.

headline.print_headline: Buy Alcohol on Sunday? Connecticut Now Allows It
headline.seo: Sunday Liquor Sales End an Era in Connecticut
headline.main: Buy Alcohol on Sunday? Connecticut Now Allows It

docs.snippet: While some were lining up at spirit shops across the state to be the first to be served on a Sunday, others were heading out to church....
docs.abstract: Connecticut's longstanding law prohibiting the sale of alcohol on Sundays ends as bill signed by Gov Dannel P Malloy in May goes into effect.
docs.lead_paragraph: While some were lining up at spirit shops across the state to be the first to be served on a Sunday, others were heading out to church.

headline.print_headline: Former Colombian Hostage Is Suspected of Role in His Capture
headline.seo: Colombia Suspects Ex-Hostage of Helping FARC Plan His Capture
headline.main: Former Colombian Hostage Is Suspected of Helping Plan His Kidnapping

docs.snippet: Sigifredo López, who was kidnapped along with 11 other legislators in 2002, has been detained under suspicion of helping the FARC plan their abduction....
docs.abstract: Sigifredo Lopez is arrested on suspicion of helping to carry out kidnapping in which he and 11 other provincial lawmakers were seized a decade ago during raid by guerrillas of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, known as FARC; Lopez, the only survivor, was freed by the rebels in 2009.

byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and JENNY CAROLINA GONZÁLEZ
byline.contributor: William Neuman reported from Caracas, and Jenny Carolina González from Bogotá, Colombia.

docs.lead_paragraph: Sigifredo López, who was kidnapped along with 11 other legislators in 2002, has been detained under suspicion of helping the FARC plan their abduction.

headline.print_headline: Old Soul’s Hard Work Turns Into Big Chance
headline.seo: Student to Attend South Carolina Boarding School
headline.main: Old Soul’s Hard Work Turns Into Big Opportunity

docs.snippet: A boy who, for pocket money, sells eggs hatched in the yard of his rural South Carolina home gained admission to a free, selective boarding school in the state....

keywords.value: South Carolina Governor's School for Science & Mathematics
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Michael Winerip On Education column profiles Louie Alexander, bright teen who has earned admission to the South Carolina Governors School for Science & Mathematics; notes that the Governor's School is a rare example of a free public boarding school with extensive resources.
docs.lead_paragraph: A boy who, for pocket money, sells eggs hatched in the yard of his rural South Carolina home gained admission to a free, selective boarding school in the state.

headline.print_headline: To an Artist, It Was a Tribute to New York; to the Police, It Was a Fake Bomb
headline.seo: Police Arrest Artist Takeshi Miyakawa, Thinking Tribute Was Fake Bomb
headline.main: To an Artist, It Was a Tribute to New York; to the Police, It Was a Fake Bomb

docs.snippet: The artist Takeshi Miyakawa was arrested in Brooklyn after his message to the city — illuminated plastic bags stamped with “I Love New York” — prompted someone to call the bomb squad....
docs.abstract: Artist Takeshi Miyakawa is arrested after he hangs illuminated plastic bags stamped with 'I Love New York,' from lamposts and trees in Brooklyn as part of an art installation; wired bags prompted one resident to call police, and Miyakawa has been charged with reckless endangerment and placing a false bomb.
docs.lead_paragraph: The artist Takeshi Miyakawa was arrested in Brooklyn after his message to the city — illuminated plastic bags stamped with “I Love New York” — prompted someone to call the bomb squad.

headline.print_headline: Theater Deal Links China To Hollywood
headline.seo: AMC Theater Deal Links China to Hollywood
headline.main: Deal Expands Chinese Influence on Hollywood

docs.snippet: The Wanda Group will buy AMC Entertainment, making the world’s largest theater group, the companies said....
docs.abstract: Wanda Group, Chinese conglomerate with extensive interests in the entertainment business, will buy AMC Entertainment in deal valued at $2.6 billion, creating the world's largest movie theater group.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Wanda Group will buy AMC Entertainment, making the world’s largest theater group, the companies said.

headline.print_headline: More Men Enter Fields Dominated by Women
headline.seo: Increasingly, Men Seek Success in Jobs Dominated by Women
headline.main: More Men Enter Fields Dominated by Women

docs.snippet: As steady full-time jobs with benefits are increasingly elusive, more men are reaching for a chance at the American dream in female-dominated occupations....
docs.abstract: More men are working in occupations traditionally dominated by women, in a search for financial security; trend started with low-skill jobs, but has spread to areas like nursing and teaching that require more education; eight of the 20 categories where, young, college-educated white men experienced the greatest job growth in the last decade were in so-called pink-collar professions (Series: The New American Job).

byline.original: By SHAILA DEWAN and ROBERT GEBELOFF

docs.lead_paragraph: As steady full-time jobs with benefits are increasingly elusive, more men are reaching for a chance at the American dream in female-dominated occupations.

headline.print_headline: Strasburg Hits First Homer As Nationals Stop Orioles
headline.seo: Nationals’ Strasburg His First Homer in Win
headline.main: Strasburg Hits First Homer as Nationals Stop Orioles

docs.snippet: Stephen Strasburg struck out eight batters in five innings and took Wei-Yin Chen deep in a 9-3 victory....
docs.abstract: MLB Roundup; Washington Nationals defeat Baltimore Orioles, 9-3; other results noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Stephen Strasburg struck out eight batters in five innings and took Wei-Yin Chen deep in a 9-3 victory.
